title: Latent optical nonclassicality of conditionally-prepared states
authors: V. S. Kovtoniuk, A. B. Klimov, A. A. Semenov
abstract:
The lack of information obtained from informationally-incomplete quantum
measurements can prevent the detection of quantum resources, such as optical
nonclassicality. We develop a technique that overcomes this limitation for
single-mode quantum states conditionally prepared through measurements on
another mode of a two-mode state. This task is performed by testing
nonclassical steering -- a class of quantum correlations beyond quantum
entanglement and quantum discord, for which we introduce a rigorous
description.
